channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous material (Lime Bikes) dumped in lake, 26th July
item.description:
Two lime bikes (with big batteries) dumped in the lake close to the edge and reasonably easy to remove. These pose a serious environmental risk if left any longer as the battery acid will pollute the wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pintail Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Old job centre building on Cambridge Road, 26th July
item.description:
The abandoned building is covered in graffiti and posters. The metal grates have been pulled off exposing the interior which is littered with rubble from the fire. The side passage is again being used as a homeless encampment. The rear cellar window coverings have been pulled off. This building has been a constant source of problems since the job centre closed and no one seems to be willing to take responsibility to keep it secure, repair it or tear it down.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead pigeon, 26th July
